channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl Developer who wants to learn Scala and NodeJS - West London
item.description: Client is a major and dynamics UK company with a large (and pretty Modern) Perl codebase who have started extended their technical stack to include Scala and NodeJS

item.title: Fancy an all-inclusive trip to The Perl Conference next year*?
item.description: This company is focused on training and shows a real commitment to staying at the cutting edge of Perl

item.title: Love independent music? Hipster not a dirty word to you? Drive forward independent music with Perl in London
item.description: help build out a Modern Perl platform ahead of international expansion

item.title: London Perl Workshop 2018
item.description: November 24th, 2018, London

item.title: Nordic Perl Workshop 2018 Highlights
item.description: Detailed highlights of Nordic Perl Workshop 2018 by brain d foy.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: C Programming Tutorial 1: Intro to C
item.description: Thorough introduction to C language.

item.title: How to build an image recognition app in React Native in 30 minutes
item.description: Follow the article to build a simple app that uses React Native's camera component to take a picture, then passes the Base64 representation of this image to the free Clarifai Predict image API to get a description of what's in the image.

item.title: Introducing Perl6::Math::Matrix (Part 1: Data)
item.description: Herbert gave talk on the above topic at The Perl Conference in Glasgow. Here he writes about the implementation of suggestions he got after his talk.

item.title: 2018.36 Normality Returns
Testing for no warnings in Perl
Perl Coding Guide line 2018
item.description: Yuki Kimoto share the coding guide line in Japanese. Please use Google translator if you are non-Japanese speaker.

item.title: Migrating a Legacy Perl app to AWS
item.description: John explains the migration process of a Legacy Perl app to AWS. I enjoyed it thoroughly.

item.title: How to be a rockstar developer in 3 months
item.description: Read this article to explore the secret behind a rockstar developer.

item.title: Dancer2::Session::Memcached
item.description: @yanick released bug fix where builder for memcache server was trying to coerce the already-coerced values.

item.title: Google unveils search engine for open data
item.description: Google has unveiled a search engine to help researchers locate online data that is freely available for use. The company launched the service on 5 September, saying that it is aimed at "scientists, data journalists, data geeks, or anyone else".

item.title: Wendigo - A proper monster for front-end automated testing
item.description: Wendigo is a wrapper of Puppeteer with the purpose of making automated testing easier and simpler.

item.title: Test Driven Development (TDD): what, when and how
item.description: Do you think you know everything about TDD? If yes then please read this article.

item.title: Which edges cases could perl shed to make it easier to parse?
item.description: brian d foy discussing if we could make a grammar that other things that aren't perl could statically parse?

item.title: Take Another Look Moose
item.description: One more blog on Moose by @byterock.

item.title: Pull Request - Mission Accomplished
item.description: I share my story of completing 1000 Pull Request.

item.title: The build process of programming languages
item.description: Read the article to gain a deeper understanding of programming and computer science.

item.title: World Tour of Germany
item.description: Damian shares the itenary of his World Tour of Germany. I just hope one day he would visit London also.

item.title: Personalize your laptop with custom labels or logo stickers from StickerYou.com
item.description: Are you looking for an easy way to wow your colleagues with the coolest laptop and desk at the office? Visit StickerYou.com for stickers, labels, decals, and more. Start branding today with laptop stickers and awesome personalized labels. You can order any size, shape, and order quantity. Use code PERL10 at checkout for 10% off.

item.title: #372 - Perl Workshop
item.description:
Hi there

During The Perl Conference in Glasgow last month, Lance Wicks shared the idea of reviving Perl Podcast. I liked the idea and we decided to work on it together. Gabor started something similar few years ago, The Perl Maven TV Show. Unfortunately not much activity seen recently. Ideally we would like focus on pure Perl (perl5 and perl6) initially. We have reached out to Joshua McAdams, creator of Perlcast for assistance.

Past one week has been really busy with Perl workshops, not just one but two i.e. Nordic Perl Workshop and Mojoconf and Swiss Perl Workshop. Unfortunately the dates clashed, making it difficult for the Perl Hackers to decide which one to go.

Talking about perl workshop, next in line is London Perl Workshop which is happening on 24th November 2018. They are accepting talk/worshop proposals now. We would love to see more first time speakers giving short (20 min) talk or even lightning (5 min) talk.
